material.mattext: A heuristic and an algorithmic solution require the same type of problem solving to develop a step by step solution to a problem.
True
False
Identifying the problem is the first step in problem solving.
True
False
Defining the knowledge base is part of understanding the problem.
True
False
The result of a problem is a set of step by step instructions.
True
False
All problems can be solved by writing a set of step by step instructions for a computer.
True
False
It is not important to evaluate a solution.
True
False
The more alternative solutions that are identified, the better chance you have of a good solution.
True
False
Any solution should be considered when solving a problem.
True
False
You can find a step-by-step solution for any problem as long as you understand the problem.
True
False
Problems that require a heuristic solution cannot be solved through a set of step by step instructions.
True
False
An algorithmic and heuristic solution require different type of problem solving to develop a step by step solution to a problem.
True
False
Set of step by step instructions is the result of a problem set.
True
False
By writing out a set of step by step instructions for a computer, all problems can be solved.
True
False
Evaluating a solution is important
True
False
By understanding the problem, you can find a step by step solution to any problem.
True
False
Problems that need a heuristic solution are solved through a set of step by step instructions.
True
False
Step 3 in problem solving is to identify alternative ways to solve the problem. This means:
To define the knowledge base of all participants.
To write a list of pros and cons for each solution.
To identify as many solutions as possible to the problem.
To identify a few solutions to the problem.
The last step in problem solving is to evaluate the solution. This means:
To check if the knowledge base for errors.
To check if the set of step by step instructions developed in step 5, list instructions that enable you to solve the problem, solve the problem identified in step 1.
To check is the solution solves a problem.
To test for understanding of the identified problem.
An algorithm is:
A solution that can not be reached through a set of step by step instructions.
The results of the problem.
The set of step by step instructions to solve the problem.
The knowledge base of a solution.
Step 4 is to select the best way to solve the problem. This means:
To weed out unacceptable solutions.
To specify pros and cons of each valid solution.
Select one solution after weighing the pros and cons.
All of the above.
A problem that requires a heuristic solution might be:

conditionvar.varequal: b Choosing stock on the stock market.

material.mattext: The solution to a problem is
The set of step-by-step instructions to solve the problem.
The program
The results.
All of the above.
After you have identified alternative solutions
You are ready to evaluate the solution(s).
You are ready to select the best solution.
You are ready to write the algorithm.
You are ready to identify the knowledge base.
To select the best solution, you should
Identify and list the pros and cons of each alternative solution.
Develop an algorithm for each solution.
Develop the knowledge base for each solution.
Identify the problem.
To create a set of instructions to make Otto walk in a figure other than a square, the following instruction(s) would need to be added to the instruction set:
Turn 1 degree, turn is always right.
Turn x degrees, where x is a given number of degrees in an angle, turn is always right.
Turn x degrees, where x is a given number of degrees in an angle, turn is always left.
Any of the above.
A set of step-by-step instructions is processed:
In the order they are presented and processed.
Can skip around to other instructions.
Can return to a previously processed instruction.
In random order.
The set of step-by-step instructions written for the solution to a problem must:
Be within the knowledge base of the problem.
Can use any instruction, regardless of the user or the machine.
Does not have to be in order of processing.
All of the above.
To identify the best alternative solutions you should:
Use other peoples ideas as well as your own.
Use only your own ideas.
Use any solution, no matter how unacceptable it is.
Identify only the first few that you think about.
When writing a set of instructions for the computer:
The instructions must be in proper order.
The instructions must be complete.
The instructions assume the computer knows nothing.
All of the above.
A problem that would require an algorithmic solution is:
Playing a game of chess.
Making a cup of cocoa.
Deciding which stock to buy.
All of the above.
Computers can best deal with problems that require:
Large amounts of calculations.
Reasoning.
Trial and error.
All of the above.
What is the first step in problem solving
identifying the problem
To check for error in the knowledge base
To test for understanding of the identified problem
To weed out unacceptable solutions
Which of the following is part of understanding the problem?
Defining the knowledge base
Identifying the problem
To identify a few solutions to the problem
To write a list of pros and cons for solution
